mapper.sql: integral_record_id, res_id, res_title, res_price, res_type, user_id, create_time, pay_status, standby1, standby2
mapper.insert:
SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()
insert into busi_integral_record
res_id,
res_title,
res_price,
res_type,
user_id,
create_time,
pay_status,
standby1,
standby2,

mapper.update:
update busi_integral_record
res_id = #{resId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
res_title = #{resTitle,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
res_price = #{resPrice,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
res_type = #{resType,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
pay_status = #{payStatus,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
standby1 = #{standby1,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
standby2 = #{standby2,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where integral_record_id = #{integralRecordId,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update busi_integral_record set res_id = #{resId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, res_title = #{resTitle,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, res_price = #{resPrice,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, res_type = #{resType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, pay_status = #{payStatus,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, standby1 = #{standby1,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, standby2 = #{standby2,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where integral_record_id = #{integralRecordId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select t1.integral_record_id AS integralRecordId, t1.res_id AS resId, t1.res_type AS resType, t1.res_title AS resTitle, t1.res_price AS resPrice, t1.user_id AS userId, t1.create_time AS createTime, t1.pay_status AS payStatus, t2.nickname AS nickname, t2.username AS userName, t2.phone phone from busi_integral_record t1 LEFT JOIN busi_user t2 ON t1.user_id = t2.user_id
and t1.res_type = #{resType}
and t1.res_title like CONCAT('%', #{resTitle},'%')
and t2.username like CONCAT('%', #{userName},'%')
and DATE_FORMAT(t1.create_time, '%Y-%m-%d')>= DATE_FORMAT(#{beginDate}, '%Y-%m-%d')
and DATE_FORMAT(t1.create_time, '%Y-%m-%d') <= DATE_FORMAT(#{endDate}, '%Y-%m-%d')
order by t1.create_time desc
